OM Group Inc. shares OMG, +0.00% surged 28% after the diversified industrial company said it has agreed to be bought by units of private-equity firm Apollo Global Management LLC for $34 a share in cash.
In a statement, OM Group said Platform Specialty Products PAH, -2.91% will buy its electronic chemicals and photomasks business from the Apollo funds in two transactions totaling $365 million.
Apollo funds will own OM Group's magnetic technologies, battery technologies and advanced organics businesses.
Shares are down 11% in the year through Friday, while the S&P 500 has gained 2.4%.
The price offers a premium of about 28% over OM Group's closing price on May 29.
